main event: A civilian in Muehlheim, Germany observed a stationary, orange-colored light in the Great Bear constellation on November 21, 1956.
interesting points: The light remained visible for 10 seconds, then blinked a few times before disappearing.
The observer did not believe the light was from an aircraft.
The light was described as similar in color and size to the planet Mars.
The report was collected by the Bad Soden Team of the 7050th Air Intelligence Group (USAFE).
The report concludes that there was 'insufficient data' to evaluate the sighting.
